Class SchemaManager

java.lang.Object
database.migration.SchemaManager
public class SchemaManager extends Object
Responsible for creating or syncing all tables whenever the app starts.

This class manages the initialization and synchronization of all database tables by invoking the syncTable() method of each table.

The SchemaManager ensures that tables are created or modified to match their expected schemas. It also provides an inspection feature to log table structures and row counts for verification purposes.

Note: The UserTable must be created first due to foreign key dependencies.

Author:
Dhruv

    • tables

      private final List<BaseTable> tables

  • Constructor Details

    • SchemaManager

      public SchemaManager()
      Initializes the SchemaManager with a predefined list of tables.

      The UserTable is added first to ensure that foreign key constraints are respected. Additional tables are added afterward.

  • Method Details

    • syncTables

      public void syncTables(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Synchronizes all tables with the database.

      This method iterates over all registered tables and calls their syncTable() method. It ensures that each table is updated to match its expected schema.

      Parameters:
      connection - The active database connection to use for table synchronization.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the connection is invalid or if a table fails to synchronize.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided connection is null or not valid.

    • inspectTables

      public void inspectTables(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Inspects the structure and row count of all tables.

      For each table, this method logs:

      • Column names, types, and sizes.
      • The number of rows present in the table.
      This method helps verify that tables are correctly synchronized and populated as expected.
      Parameters:
      connection - The active database connection to use for table inspection.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.
